The quick pace, coop, "Zombie," shooting of Killing Floor is VERY good. This is one of those games everyone should have in their Steam library, that being said this review is pointless because everyone already owns this game.

LOVE IT! Way better than expected always fun playing with a team and the maps are huge. Good places to survive in and I love that they let us use a tool to lock doors shut. The classes are balanced with their own pros and cons so it is a team effort. Graphics are good and the gameplay is great. My only complaint is that the game can feel a bit repetitive but that isn't a big deal. I still enjoy this game.

It's the right amount of blood, gore, and British accents for the appocalypse.

You should try it if you are a fan of counterstrike and zombies. You might wanna hold out till it goes on sale to try it if you are a giant L4D2 fan, or have few other mates who have KF to play with. 

Killing floor is not as graphically impressive as its main rival, Left 4 Dead 2 - but it makes that up in witty British humor and more realistic feeling guns. The shopkeeper's sexual references are as subtle as a sledgehammer to the baubles, look out for that - or don't; you'll get them regardless :D 

I also enjoy the fact that the levels are designed in a manner that teamwork is ESSENTIAL to survive to the final waves. 

The purchasing mechanic can be quite clunky but with a team that can share funds, this feels more true to a deathmatch, where as L4D2 does not. L4D2 however, has a 'flow' to it that is uninterrupted by the 'waves of enemies' mechanic, which I am not quite fond of, but understand in terms of a first person multiplayer battle arena.
Freaking Fantastic with consistent update of new content!

On it's own this is a fun, low-thought game.  Don't expect to need elaborate plans and tactics, this game is simply about killing zombies...lots and lots of them.  Class progression through the game's seven classes adds some interest to the game, though some classes are MUCH more difficult to level than others.  Grab some friends and the mayhem (and fun) get increased exponentially.  Good times.

Ok so my opinion has changed a bit in the last few weeks. Setup a a good xpadder profile for the xbox controller and joined a few community events and actually found this game to be a little more fun than my first review.... below... it was harsh lol. Good teamates and being able to play to with the input device i preffered seems to have been all it took. hopfully KF2 will feature controller options for people like me.

OLD REVIEW!
"I wish this game was fun... enough people really love it that it stays around and they support the it year after year with even and new content. But the game is just not fun and i keep hearing over and over again "if you play it for millions of hours it will become fun once you level up!" that not what a fun game is like. thats like playing a shitty game for months untill it lets you have a tank/god mode cheat code. or soemthing. i mean its awesome that tripwire is a great dev team and are dedicated to their product forever but its just not one for me."

WOW. This game is extremely impressive.  It doesn't woo anybody with amazing graphics or textures, but this game, simply put, is just explosively fun.  You can never get bored of plowing your way through ten levels of zombie after zombie with 5 of your friends, with crazy and absurd guns that never cease to bore you.  And with free updates and maps, for 20 dollars, you cannot go wrong with this game.  I would've paid double that for this game, and still would today.  Amazing survival game, maybe the best in its class, with loads of replayability. 97/100

I bought this game with the internship of letting my eight year old son learn about interior design but instead he got a large number of men from australia complain about how much money they have. I don't care if you are from a predigious background or not it is just rude to wave your money in someones face just because you can afford more guns and bullets. There was a man who threw his money in the air but he caught it before i could and then had the nerve to ask what i was doing. we were then rudely interrupted by a man with no flesh who killed the first man. overall it is a great tool but i think there could have been more emphasis on textures (there are only like three) rather than having lots of dead policemen with no skin killing rude people with money. I know a lot about this because I was in #occupy 2012 and it was really cold but i perversered because i am trying to make the world a better place and make all the rich people give me some because i have worked so hard and my eight year old son can't even design the layout of my new kitchen. If i ran this game then i would make it so that the guns can shoot the complaining australian men too which i think was the whole point of #occupy and isn't that what we're all fighting for???

This game can be highly addicting, IF and only if, you have people to play with. Team classes are all unique, and each one of your team members will matter a great deal especially if you are to beat the map on Suicidal or Hell on Earth. There's just something so satisfying about blowing the brains out of flaming zombies, or Specimen as they're called in this game. The graphics look like they should for a game released in 2009. The one annoying thing I found with the game is that only 32MB of memory is allocated to it by default, and so the game lagged constantly. I then had to scour the killingfloor.ini file to find that line of code so I could increase the amount of RAM allocated to the game. An overall great game. A not-so-hidden gem, if you will.

Killing Floor is an incredible co-operative survival shooter. You can play solo, or join up with up to 5 other players to face waves of specimen trying to kill you. The specimen are enemies with big variety. Some are weak but can be tough in groups. Some are tough and can kill your whole squad single-handedly if you're poorly prepared.

After each wave the game will progressively become harder, and tougher specimen will spawn. Between each wave the trader will open up her shop and you will be able to purchase a variety of weapons. You all have a perk that gives you bonuses and makes you more effective with certain weapons and levels up as you play. For example Support specialist are good with shotguns, commandos with assault rifles, berserkers with melee weapons and so on. After all rounds are complete you will face the final boss, the patriarch, and your teamwork will be put to the test.

The game can get rather difficult. One big part about this game is the progression and the long learning curve. You won't be able to beat every map on the first try. You will learn about the enemies, the maps, the perks and the weapons as you play. And after mastering a difficulty you can move on to a higher difficulty and the rules will change. You will need new spots to defend at, new weapons to use and new tactics. This might be a drawback to some, but to somebody who likes long learning curves, it's perfect.

The graphics are very good but not the latest. The game is from 2009 but still has impressive graphics. It's well optimized and can run well on decent hardware. The maps varies in quality but some are very well made and makes for a very good atmosphere. The game has quite some gore. It is well made and can be enjoyed during the Zed time. Zed time is when the whole server goes slow motion for a few seconds. Watching a Fleshpund blow to pieces right before you just as he about to shred you to pieces in slow motion is nothing short of awesome.

The audio is also very good. The sound effects and the music are well made. The music changes from map to map and really adds to the atmosphere. It's fast-paced during the waves and makes shooting specimen a lot more fun.

Killing Floor also has season events, three times a year. Every summer, halloween and winter all skins of the specimen change  during the event. New maps, weapons and achievements are also introduced. It keeps the game constantly fresh and always fun to come back to.

Killing Floor is a really great game. It has improved a lot since it was released and still does wth constant updates. I highly recommend it.

This game has some very fun elements and some great ideas, but it couldn't have been executed any more poorly if the devs had actually been trying to make a bad game.  The enemies are essentially bullet sponges that use no tactics except to overwhelm you.  The difficulty is designed for leet players only (this 'game' was obviously not meant to be fun - only challenging).  If you can find a place where they don't just whomp you, then you have to be VERY careful that you don't run out of ammo.  If you die, you are punished and have everything taken away from you - if you die more than a few levels in, it's likely you won't get enough money to purchase anything useful and will thus spend the remaining rounds being killed over and over again and being punished by the game for the fact that the game itself just sucks.  Also, when you respawn, you start far away from the vendor, so you spend almost all your time running to the vendor, then dealing with the amatuerish UI before time runs out.
Killing Floor is a great game. If you dont like it, your adopted.

Very fun game with lots of replayability. Class system w/ranking provides motivation to continue playing. Surprisingly, some of the best co-op I've experienced online comes from this game. Variety of maps and classes keeps the game interesting for hours on end. Would recommend over any L4D.
